faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: What is the difference between a certified and a sworn translation?
faq.a1: In many contexts, these terms are used interchangeably. It refers to a translation confirmed by a court-authorized translator, which is legally recognized by authorities.
faq.q2: How fast will I receive the translation?
faq.a2: Standard documents (e.g., birth certificates) are often processed within 24-48 hours. Postal delivery from Spain to Germany takes approx. 3-5 business days.
faq.q3: Do you need the original document?
faq.a3: In most cases, a high-quality scan is sufficient. The translation will state 'translated from scan'. Please check with your authority (accepted in 99% of cases).
faq.q4: Is the translation valid in Germany?
faq.a4: Yes. As a translator authorized by the OLG Cologne, my translations are recognized by all German authorities and courts.
faq.a5: You will receive an invoice including VAT. Payment is made conveniently via bank transfer.

aboutPage.title: Your certified translator
aboutPage.subtitle: Over 30 years connecting Spain and Germany
aboutPage.introduction: I'm María Ángeles Capas, a sworn translator with the dual accreditation you need: appointed by the Spanish Ministry of Foreign Affairs and authorized by the Higher Regional Court of Cologne (Germany).
aboutPage.paragraph1: For over three decades, I've been helping individuals, law firms, notaries, and companies overcome language barriers in their international procedures. I know that when you need a certified translation, what you really need is peace of mind: that your document will be accepted the first time, without rejections or complications.
aboutPage.paragraph2: My specialization in law, economics, and official documentation allows me to translate with the terminological precision that official bodies require. Every comma, every legal term, every formality counts.
aboutPage.paragraph3: I work from Ourense (Spain), but my German authorization allows me to offer translations valid in both countries without additional apostille. An advantage that few translators can offer.
aboutPage.conclusion: Direct contact, no intermediaries. You talk to me, I translate your document, and I deliver it personally. It's that simple.
